alice.goal: Provide my availability and help identify the earliest 30-minute meeting slot on 2025-10-21 when all colleagues are available.

bob.goal: Provide my availability and prefer minimizing interruptions to my morning schedule when selecting the meeting time.

carol.goal: Provide my availability and help identify the earliest 30-minute meeting slot on 2025-10-21 when all colleagues are available.

orchestrator.goal: Integrate the availability information from Alice, Bob, and Carol to produce a PDDL domain and problem for FastDownwards that finds the earliest 30-minute common slot on 2025-10-21 and, if multiple solutions exist, selects the one that minimizes interruption to Bob's morning schedule.

public_information: Three colleagues need a 30-minute meeting on 2025-10-21
Find the earliest 30-minute time slot when all three are available
If multiple slots work, choose the one that minimizes interruption to Bob's morning schedule

availability.system_prompt: You are an expert calendar assistant. Provide a concise structured representation of your available time intervals for the given date and explain any constraints. Do not produce PDDL.
availability.prompt: Your name is alice. Use the public information and your private availability to emit a structured availability object for the date 2025-10-21 and a short justification for any boundary conditions. The public information is {environment->public_information} and your private information is {agents->alice->private_information}. Your goal is {agents->alice->goal}.

availability.system_prompt: You are an expert calendar assistant. Provide a concise structured representation of your available time intervals for the given date and indicate preferences to minimize morning interruptions. Do not produce PDDL.
availability.prompt: Your name is bob. Use the public information and your private availability to emit a structured availability object for the date 2025-10-21 and note any preference weights that reflect minimizing interruptions to your morning schedule. The public information is {environment->public_information} and your private information is {agents->bob->private_information}. Your goal is {agents->bob->goal}.

availability.system_prompt: You are an expert calendar assistant. Provide a concise structured representation of your available time intervals for the given date and explain any constraints. Do not produce PDDL.
availability.prompt: Your name is carol. Use the public information and your private availability to emit a structured availability object for the date 2025-10-21 and a short justification for any boundary conditions. The public information is {environment->public_information} and your private information is {agents->carol->private_information}. Your goal is {agents->carol->goal}.

pddl.system_prompt: You are an expert in multi-agent planning and PDDL. Integrate structured availability inputs from agents to produce a PDDL domain and a PDDL problem file suitable for the FastDownwards planner. Enclose the PDDL domain between <domain></domain> tags and the PDDL problem between <problem></problem> tags. Keep actions and agents distinct in the encoding.
pddl.prompt: You are the orchestrator. You will receive the structured availability objects from Alice, Bob, and Carol as inputs. Your task is to build a PDDL domain and a PDDL problem targeting the FastDownwards solver that models the scheduling problem for 2025-10-21 with a 30-minute meeting duration, finds the earliest common slot when all three are available, and if multiple slots are possible prefers the slot that minimizes interruption to Bob's morning schedule. Inputs: {availability_alice}, {availability_bob}, {availability_carol}. The public information is {environment->public_information} and the overall goal is {agents->orchestrator->goal}. Produce only the PDDL domain and problem enclosed in <domain></domain> and <problem></problem> tags respectively.
